    • Method Detail

      • validateTime

        public void validateTime(java.util.Date currentTime,
                         Certificate[] certificateChain,
                         boolean entireChain)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                         InvalidCertificateException
        Method to verify that the given certificates are valid against the specified time.
        Specified by:
        validateTime in interface TimeValidator
        Parameters:
        currentTime - the expected time to verify the certificate against.
        certificateChain - the certificate to verify region in, end entity certificate first and root cert last.
        entireChain - if entireChain should be validated or only first certificate in chain.
        Throws:
        InvalidCertificateException - if the given certificate chain was invalid for the specified time.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if other argument was invalid when validation the certificate.

      • toEndDate

        protected java.util.Date toEndDate(java.util.Date startDate,
                                   Duration duration)
                            throws InvalidCertificateException
        Method to get the end date of a certificate from its start date and duration.
        Parameters:
        startDate - the start date to calculate end date from
        duration - the duration to add to the start date.
        Returns:
        a calculated end date.
        Throws:
        InvalidCertificateException - if duration contained invalid parameters, such as microseconds unit.

      • durationAsMS

        protected long durationAsMS(Duration duration)
                     throws InvalidCertificateException
        Help method to convert durations that is not microseconds or years to milliseconds (unsupported)
        Parameters:
        duration - the duration to convert to milliseconds.
        Returns:
        the duration in milliseconds
        Throws:
        InvalidCertificateException - if duration was specified in microseconds.
